authors.name: Ryan Teague
authors.affiliation: North Carolina State University, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsbsv","text":"This protocol was developed for BIT 495: Special Topics in Biotechnology: Portable Genome Sequencing at North Carolina State University. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tac1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbu18","text":"            The purpose of this protocol is to consistently complete genomic assemblies of plasmid DNA from bacterial cultures. This is done by ensuring that the DNA is sequenced with long DNA reads, which helps the DNA preserve its integrity and decreases the chance of the sample having multiple contigs in the final assembly. This protocol has been optimized to produce high-quality reads from the most difficult-to-extract plasmid DNA. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cofm3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22mma","text":"This protocol is broken down into a few key steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b5ic","text":"A bacterial colony is grown, and then the plasmids are extracted using the method given below","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1evap","text":"The DNA is purified from the plasmids by using a slight variation of the QIAprep Spin Miniprep kit ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3odl","text":"The DNA library will be made using the Ligation Sequencing kit but with a custom protocol designed for plasmids","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dou8","text":"Load this sample into a MinION flow cell and use a MinION sequencer to extract the reads","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3kcv","text":"The analysis of our samples will be completed using BV-BRC","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6hv9o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5k964","text":"Note: For the last two steps of this process (the sequencing and analysis) there will be no strict procedures given, only brief descriptions. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":142}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0v71","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"526ij","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9j76v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7913E2FCCC1E4914B60C58CF3B212EC7","height":186.03773584905656,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXcmrM5itbzR2Z0Ntf_2hC08OqyHyndC_zzC4Pr9_F4QueOiBrcpMz3_h4zTAycBMT6dbaRHpJ-xYrcpjY0w3NfPz7FMzxByM57WRgfHcWVsjicH5SXVKyZ3ZPm7ed4Y4U5JRG6SjoeZoPv4rNDvF9pSWn41?key=06lE2FeidcwgdVWTAEa_ow","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXcmrM5itbzR2Z0Ntf_2hC08OqyHyndC_zzC4Pr9_F4QueOiBrcpMz3_h4zTAycBMT6dbaRHpJ-xYrcpjY0w3NfPz7FMzxByM57WRgfHcWVsjicH5SXVKyZ3ZPm7ed4Y4U5JRG6SjoeZoPv4rNDvF9pSWn41?key=06lE2FeidcwgdVWTAEa_ow","width":580}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqr3g","text":"When following this protocol, ensure that all steps are carried out under sterile conditions to avoid contamination of the plasmid DNA. Always use fresh reagents, and handle all materials with care to maintain the integrity of your samples. Pipette accurately and avoid excessive vortexing to prevent shearing of the DNA. Consistently monitor centrifugation speeds and times to ensure proper separation during plasmid extraction and purification. For DNA quantification, ensure calibration of equipment such as NanoDrop and Qubit Fluorometer. Follow manufacturer instructions when using commercial kits like the QIAprep Spin Miniprep kit and Ligation Sequencing Kit V14 to achieve optimal results. You may pause this process between any major section of this protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Genomic DNA by Ligation: SQK-LSK114, https://nanoporetech.com/document/genomic-dna-by-ligation-sqk-lsk114.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":67,"length":68}],"data":{}},{"key":"93oqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cg64","text":"Oxford Nanopore Technologies. \"Nanopore Sequencing Technology Explained,\" YouTube, uploaded by Nanopore Tech, 21 July 2022, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IknVaEnuDz0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":124,"length":43}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C83DDD4B81B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10996661"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0D1A81B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10415192"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0D4881B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/purify-plasmid-dna"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0D7081B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://a.storyblok.com/f/196663/32d88b314d/plasmid-workflow.pdf"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0D9981B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://nanoporetech.com/document/epi2me"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0DC681B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://nanoporetech.com/document/rapid-sequencing-v14-plasmid-sequencing-sqk-rbk114-96"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0DF281B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://nanoporetech.com/document/genomic-dna-by-ligation-sqk-lsk114"}},"7":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E94B0CEA81B611EF83D70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IknVaEnuDz0"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cq9es","text":"To start, obtain an overnight culture of bacteria (of whatever type of bacteria)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2dp5i","text":"Centrifuge the culture to pellet the bacteria","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdn36","text":"Remove all supernatant and resuspend the bacteria in the resuspension buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5sm7m","text":"Add a denaturing solution to the resuspended bacteria ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8pp0g","text":"This will lyse the bacteria to release their contents (including plasmid DNA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":77}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3q4dd","text":"Add a renaturing solution to the denatured bacteria","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dge6l","text":"This causes proteins and genomic DNA to precipitate while leaving smaller plasmids in the solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 1. Plasmid Extraction from Bacterial Colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"flmpc","text":"Pellet the proteins and genomic DNA by centrifugation, and remove the plasmid-containing supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bd7ot","text":"Add an equal volume of absolute ethanol into each tube and mix by inverting the tubes a few times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dptie","text":"Centrifuge the tubes at 20,000× g (15,000 rpm) for 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2jr8a","text":"Decant the supernatant and carefully remove the liquid completely using a pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"21d23","text":"Add 300 μL of TE buffer (pH 8.0) (see recipe above), 150 μL of 5 M NaCl (see recipe above), and 45 μL of 20% SDS (see recipe above). Mix by inversion and incubate at 65 °C in a heating block for at least 10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":63,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":105,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7e9ak","text":"Add an equal volume (500 μL) of CIA (see recipe above) and keep shaking on a Nutating Mixer for at least 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5vs99","text":"Centrifuge at 20,000× g (15,000 rpm) for 7–10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4gmje","text":"Carefully transfer the upper phase (~400 μL) into new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes, add 16 μL (20 mg/mL) of RNase, mix well by inversion, and incubate at 37 °C in a heated block for at least 15 min. Add an equal volume of CIA and keep shaking on a Nutating Mixer for at least 5 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4ahv3","text":"Centrifuge at 20,000× g (15,000 rpm) for 7–10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8v4u5","text":"Carefully transfer the upper phase (300 μL) into new 1.5 mL Eppendorf tubes, add an equal volume of absolute ethanol, and mix well by inversion","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"gqdo","text":"Centrifuge at 20,000× g (15,000 rpm) for 7–10 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dkun9","text":"Carefully decant or pipette out the liquid phase and add 500 μL of 70% ethanol. Tap the tube to release the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"15gop","text":"Centrifuge at 20,000× g (15,000 rpm) for 1–2 min and repeat step 11","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fmqh9","text":"Add 50 μL (if the pellet is large, add more volume) of TE Buffer. Completely dissolve the pellet by finger-tapping","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 2. DNA Purification From Plasmid
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ddtdl","text":"Measure the quantity of the plasmid DNA using NanoDrop and using Qubit (this concentration will be helpful for the next steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6tnlm","text":"Use the Qubit Fluorometer to find the concentration of plasmid DNA in your sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4rmt9","text":"Adjust the volume/concentration to get 1 ug of plasmid DNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q4lh","text":"This ensures that long reads will be obtained in this process","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5p3o","text":"Transfer 1 μg input DNA into a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e749s","text":"Adjust the volume to 48 μl with nuclease-free water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2lu66","text":"Mix thoroughly by pipetting up and down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5b0ho","text":"Spin Down with the microfuge ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1cu0v","text":"In a 0.2 ml thin-walled PCR tube, mix the following (pipette mix between each addition):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2gps","text":"48 uL of the DNA sample ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6crg","text":"2 uL of NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Buffer v2","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btra6","text":"2 uL of NEBNext FFPE DNA Repair Mix","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ve1","text":"3 uL of Ultra II End-prep Enzyme Mix","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4llg4","text":"Mix the reaction and gently spin it down ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b454u","text":"Incubate with the Thermocycler at 20°C for 5 minutes and 65°C for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ephga","text":"Transfer the DNA sample to a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"do0d3","text":"Resuspend the AMPure XP Beads (AXP) by vortexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esghv","text":"Add 60 µl of resuspended AMPure XP Beads (AXP) to the end-prep reaction and mix by flicking the tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"76h8n","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer for 10 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eev07","text":"Prepare 500 μl of fresh 80% ethanol in nuclease-free water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14b9v","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet until the supernatant is clear and colorless. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb8vh","text":"Keep the tube on the magnet and wash the beads with 200 µl of freshly prepared 80% ethanol without disturbing the pellet. Remove the ethanol using a pipette and discard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8kao7","text":"Repeat the previous step","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1rpa4","text":"Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual ethanol. Allow to dry for ~15 seconds, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":80}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aljq0","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in 61 µl nuclease-free water. Incubate for 2 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0tiv","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colorless, for at least 1 minute","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"amkj1","text":"Remove and retain 61 µl of eluate into a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.1 Library Preparation of DNA - DNA Repair and End Prep
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e3s74","text":"Quantity 1 uL of the eluted sample using a Qubit Fluorometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9q78h","text":"Make note of the sample’s DNA concentration ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dfoni","text":"Thaw all reagents, individually spin them down, and store them on ice ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"379fl","text":"In a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube, mix in the following order:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3van","text":"60 uL of the DNA sample ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5656k","text":"5 uL of the ligation adapter ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjnfn","text":"25 uL of the ligation buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cem6k","text":"10 uL of the Salt-T4® DNA Ligase","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6p0sl","text":"Thoroughly mix the reaction by gently pipetting and briefly spinning down","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bv4gm","text":"Incubate the reaction for 10 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6umiv","text":"Resuspend the AMPure XP Beads (AXP) by vortexing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1no17","text":"Add 40 µl of resuspended AMPure XP Beads (AXP) to the reaction and mix by flicking the tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bud2","text":"Incubate on a Hula mixer (rotator mixer) for 10 minutes at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"35d12","text":"Spin down the sample and pellet on a magnet. Keep the tube on the magnet, and pipette off the supernatant when clear and colorless","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63upa","text":"Wash the beads by adding 250 μl Long Fragment Buffer (LFB). Flick the beads to resuspend, spin down, then return the tube to the magnetic rack and allow the beads to pellet. Remove the supernatant using a pipette and discard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3oh2r","text":"Repeat the previous step","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4kpbn","text":"Spin down and place the tube back on the magnet. Pipette off any residual supernatant. Allow to dry for ~15 seconds, but do not dry the pellet to the point of cracking","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":63}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"djre6","text":"Remove the tube from the magnetic rack and resuspend the pellet in a 15 µl Elution Buffer (EB). Spin down and incubate for 10 minutes at 37°C to improve the recovery of long fragments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":123,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bro9f","text":"Pellet the beads on a magnet until the eluate is clear and colorless, for at least 3 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8l90a","text":"Remove and retain 15 µl of eluate containing the DNA library in a clean 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2t8f3","text":"Measure the concentration of the sample using the Qubit Fluorometer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3mcqr","text":"Prepare your final library as at least 300 ng of Plasmid DNA into 12 uL of elution buffer ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c61ct","text":"This ensures long reads of the plasmid DNA ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9n5p5","text":"The priming mixture is made as follows  in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf LoBind tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66t9h","text":"1170 uL of Flow Cell Flush  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah8gq","text":"5 uL of Bovine Serum Albumin (BSA) at 50 mg/ml","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cak2k","text":"30 uL of Flow Cell Tether ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 3.2 Library Preparation of DNA - Adapter Ligation and Clean Up
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"607av","text":"The Final Library mixture is made as follows in a 1.5 mL Eppendorf LoBind tube: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"375ei","text":"37.5 uL of Sequencing Buffer ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9i7qr","text":"25.5 uL of Library Beads (LIB) mixed immediately before use","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vkom","text":"12 uL of DNA library","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: 4. Nanopore Sequencing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5pubo","text":"This section won’t be in detail, but the library sample will be inserted into the MinION flow cell, which will hook up to the GridION sequencer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ako8","text":"Here is a video tutorial on priming and loading the MinION Flow Cell: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IknVaEnuDz0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":113}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":43}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"55332B60810411EF84F70A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IknVaEnuDz0"}}}}

steps.section: 5. Sequencing Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0f97","text":"This section will also not be in detail, but the results from the sequencing will be run into a comprehensive genome analysis on the BV-BRC website software","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Genomic Assembly of Plasmid DNA from Bacterial Cultures

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"cdi0v","text":"Handle all chemicals, especially chloroform and ethanol, in a fume hood to avoid inhalation of fumes. Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) such as lab coats, gloves, and safety goggles at all times. Chloroform is toxic and should be handled with extreme caution—dispose of it in designated waste containers following hazardous waste protocols. Ensure that all centrifuge tubes are balanced before use to avoid damage to the equipment or sample loss. Use RNase with care, as it can degrade RNA unintentionally if mishandled. Finally, be cautious when handling electrical equipment such as the MinION sequencer and thermal cycler to prevent equipment damage or personal injury.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
